person.persName: James Howard (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer, clerk, attorney, and postmaster.)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer, clerk, attorney, and postmaster. Kentucky native. Son of John Beale Howard, Jr. and Elizabeth Anderson Howard. Married to Theresa Clem Howard in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on December 8, 1861. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1850. Owned at least three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1851. Circuit court clerk in Montgomery County in 1855. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Household owned an additional nine enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1861. Claims agent in Montgomery County in 1862. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1863. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1863. United States postmaster general in Montgomery County from July 28, 1864, through 1875.
